FRIDAY, MARCH 6, 1885.

NEW DEPARTURE

THE WEEKLY GLOBE
SPECIAL TRIAL TRIP—TWO MONTHS
ONLY 15 CENTS

Commencing Feb. 26th, the following editions of The Weekly Globe will be mailed to subscribers throughout Canada, the United States, and other countries:

Daily Globe—Tuesday Edition
Daily Globe—Wednesday Edition
Daily Globe—Thursday Edition
Daily Globe—Friday Edition
Daily Globe—Saturday Morning Edition

THE GLOBE has special arrangements by which it possesses the sole right in Canada, as well as in the United States, of the publication of the following series of newspapers:

The Globe, under special arrangement for the Dominion of Canada, Toronto, Ont., and the United States, New York, N.Y.

In addition to the above-mentioned newspapers, there are always running in the 3rd and 4th sections of THE GLOBE, and in THE WEEKLY GLOBE, one or more additional newspapers by authority of the Government of Canada, the Dominion of Canada, and the United States.

An agricultural newspaper, THE WEEKLY GLOBE is unsurpassed.

SPURGEON'S SERMON

Address, THE GLOBE PRINTING CO., TORONTO.

PRINCE ALBERT HIGH SCHOOL

Under the auspices of the
PRESBYTERIAN CHURCH OF CANADA.

This School will be opened on
TUESDAY, 10TH MARCH,

When Classes will be formed in
English, Latin, Greek, French, Mathematics, and the other Subjects taught in Public and High Schools.

Until other arrangements can be made, the School will be conducted by
Rev. W. McWILLIAM, M.A., LL.B.,
And Rev. R. G. SINCLAIR.

Prince Albert - N.W.T
Dominion Parliament.

The Hon. Mr. Pope, Minister of Agriculture, has appointed a commission to review the status of the provinces. The commission will be appointed by the Governor General and will consist of three members. The commission will report its findings to the Governor General within six months.

The commission will consider the following issues:

1. The distribution of federal funds among the provinces.
2. The implementation of the federal-provincial agreement on environmental protection.
3. The impact of federal policies on the economy of each province.

The commission will present its report to the Governor General in June 1986.

STEWART J. C. MACKENZIE
